title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. Derek Jeter stepped down as CEO and sold his 4% stake, washing his hands of which baseball team?

A. The New York Yankees

B. The New York Mets

C. The Miami Marlins

D. The Montreal Expos

---

2. Which company just invited the United Auto Workers to hold an organizing vote among its workers?

A. Meta

B. Amazon

C. Walmart

D. Tesla

---

3. Stephen Schwarzman was paid $1.1 billion in 2021 -- for doing what job?

A. CEO of Blackstone

B. President of Blackrock

C. Chief investment officer of Renaissance Technologies

D. University of Alabama football coach

---

4. Rep. Nancy Mace of South Carolina is facing a GOP primary challenge -- from whom?

A. Annie Andrews

B. Katie Arrington

C. Nikki Haley

D. Jackie Hayes

---

5. Ralph Nader is having trouble selling a new manuscript to a publisher. What's it about?

A. How Democrats can win the next election

B. Cooking Lebanese cuisine

C. The virtues of nuclear power

D. CEOs he's known and liked

---

6. A new TV series dramatizes the rise and fall of Elizabeth Holmes and Theranos. What's it called?

A. "Just One Drop"

B. "The Dropout"

C. "Drop a Bundle"

D. "Those Eyes"

---

7. A cargo ship loaded with luxury cars sank after a devastating fire. How many vehicles were on board?

A. 40

B. 400

C. 4,000

D. 40,000

---

8. Fed chief Jerome Powell said he'll propose a quarter-point rate hike. What did he say about his expectations?

A. "The smart money will move into crypto."

B. "Inflation won't moderate until mid-2023."

C. "There are no guarantees in life."

D. "The Fed can meet government borrowing needs for the foreseeable future."

---

9. France seized a 280-foot yacht linked to Russian tycoon Igor Sechin. What's the vessel's name?

A. The Amore Vero

B. The Anima Perduta

C. The Buon Vicino

D. The Orso Pazzo

---

ANSWERS

1. C

2. D

3. A

4. B

5. D

6. B

7. C

8. C

9. A
